article.title: A Little Commonwealth Family Life in Plymouth Colony
article.author: Demos, J.
article.text: The kind of study presented in this monograph has not as yet won a wide following among working historians. On the whole their interest has remained with the larger units of social action: the region, the class, the party, the ethnic or religious group. It has been left to the so-called behavioral sciences - anthropology, sociology, psychology - to demonstrate the fundamental importance of the smallest and most intimate of all group environments, the family.
